children.subject: Can a screen be set to change between phases (allow declared students to enroll directly now but make them wait list for phase 2) to resolve this issue??

history.content:
Note: If you are not declaring this semester, then you should NOT waitlist upper division CS courses, because the waitlist will be purged prior to Phase II of any student who is not declared.

Per my understanding, once the screen is fixed by SIS, the enrollment procedure will be changed back to what it was before.

edit by asker: " the waitlist will be purged prior to Phase II of any student who is not declared" means that if I do wait list a cs upper div phase 1, I will remain on the wait list during phase 2 as major apps will be processed by that time. So I would be in line for an upper div ahead of other declared CS majors adding the class in phase 2. Can anyone official confirm?

Note: If you are not declaring this semester, then you should NOT waitlist upper division CS courses, because the waitlist will be purged prior to Phase II of any student who is not declared.

Per my understanding, once the screen is fixed by SIS, the enrollment procedure will be changed back to what it was before.

edit by asker: " the waitlist will be purged prior to Phase II of any student who is not declared" means that if I do wait list a cs upper div phase 1, I will remain on the wait list during phase 2 as major apps will be processed by that time. So I would be in line for an upper div ahead of other declared CS majors adding the class in phase 2.

Note: If you are not declaring this semester, then you should NOT waitlist upper division CS courses, because the waitlist will be purged prior to Phase II of any student who is not declared.

Per my understanding, once the screen is fixed by SIS, the enrollment procedure will be changed back to what it was before.

Note: If you are not declaring this semester, then you should NOT waitlist upper division CS courses, because the waitlist will be purged prior to Phase II of any student who is not declared.

Per the old policy, only declared students could waitlist in Phase I (with only declared seniors being able to enroll directly). Undeclared students would be unable to waitlist until Phase II.

Per this new policy, now all declared students can enroll directly. Undeclared students are still unable to waitlist until Phase II.

In both policies, unless something goes wrong with SIS (which I don't feel comfortable saying it won't), once Phase II starts, everyone is put on the waitlist. So no, in Phase II, declared students would not be able to skip ahead of you and enroll directly. This was true in the old policy, and is still true now.

The only time declared students would skip ahead of you is if you were on the waitlist in Phase I. Which, since you are undeclared, you should not be on (unless you are going to be declaring by the end of the semester).

children.subject: I meant that this will happen before Phase II, but after the major application processing.
Right, but that isn't the issue. The issue is that I now have a lower priority in Phase 1 than everyone not declaring this semester does in Phase 2.
Unless once my major app is processed, then in Phase 2 I can directly enroll into a class which would make whatever waitlist I was on during Phase 1 useless.

I think that's not the correct interpretation of " the waitlist will be purged prior to Phase II of any student who is not declared"

because by phase 2, they will have processed major applications.

history.content:
1.  It is my understanding that this is a feature and not a bug in SIS.  As far as I know, we will likely not be able to limit access to waitlists in any way other than by not having a waitlist open.  This means that our previous enrollment policy will at some point need to be adjusted -- which would have already happened if SIS had given us this information when we asked 4-5 months ago but here we are.

2. The student who asked the question is confused as this situation will actually benefit students declaring this semester as the waitlist will be processed enrolling them (capacity permitting) once they are declared which will happen at the end of phase 1 before phase 2 begins.  In the past, students currently undeclared would not be able to put themselves on waitlists until they had already been declared and would not be enrolled until at least phase 2 unless they also had senior standing.

From @1232, "At this point, for both phase 1 or phase 2 of enrollments, we will change the screen so that anyone who is officially declared LSCS or EECS will be able to enroll in upper div cs classes." This would mean that as a declaring sophomore, even if I waitlist a class during my phase 1 (in a desperate attempt to actually get into a class, how silly of me) then anyone declared can just skip ahead of me during their phase 2 and enroll directly while I'm still on the waitlist! Surely this isn't intentional, right?
history.subject: Unintended consequence of new policy!?
